question_text: Tell me a time when your colleagues did not agree with your approach. What did you do to bring them into the conversation and address their concerns?

What is your approach to resolving conflict with co-workers or external stakeholders, partially when you don’t really like them?
Give an example of when you resolved a conflict with someone on the job.
How do you prioritize multiple deadlines? Additionally, how do you stay organized when you have multiple deadlines?

question_keywords: Why Do You Want to Work With Us
question_text:
When an interviewer asks you a question along the lines of:

Why did you apply to our company?
What are you looking for in your next job?
What makes you a good fit for our company?

How should you respond?
How would you convey insights and the methods you use to a non-technical audience?
Describe a data project you worked on. What were some of the challenges you faced?

You’re a product manager at Meta. In a few weeks, there is an upcoming stakeholder meeting, and they want you to suggest a new feature for Instagram Stories. What would this feature be, and what would be the rationale behind choosing such a feature?
Tell me about a project in which you had to clean and organize a large dataset.
What are some effective ways to make data more accessible to non-technical people?
How comfortable are you presenting your insights?
Talk about a time when you had trouble communicating with stakeholders. How were you able to overcome it?
Tell me about a time when you exceeded expectations during a project. What did you do, and how did you accomplish it?

When an interviewer asks a question along the lines of:

What would your current manager say about you? What constructive criticisms might he give?
What are your three biggest strengths and weaknesses you have identified in yourself?

How would you respond?
Describe an analytics experiment that you designed. How were you able to measure success?

Let’s say you work at Meta and currently Facebook allows users to specify whether or not a person is single or is in a relationship.
However, running through the reports shows that users with partners tend to make fewer posts. How would you approach tackling this issue? What might we want to do to increase engagement for this demographic?
